column5: And you thought crappie rigs were prone to tangles? hehe
That will be the newest craze on the salmon tribs come the fall.
Perfect photo of pushing the envelope ....
That's a good photo shop.  No way that rod could throw over a pound of weight without bending right in half.
Looks like a big stick to me...
lol, that lure will hit em right in the back of the head on the cast, he should be wearing a life jacket!!!

I assumed its a photoshop job as well....(although the rig would be closer to 1/4 lb)....still thought it was funny though. I find the actual alabama rig ridiculous.......so this was hilarious.  And actually if you look, each rig has 5 wires for 5 baits........and the first 3 he uses 4 baits and ties the next rig to the 5th wire until the last one where he uses 5 baits. Its a well thought out photoshop if it is lol
Randall Tharp proving a point with photoshop.
more i look at it, the more i think its a legit image......but its being used jokingly. LIke i said....u can just take one of the five wires and hook the next rig to it on down the line
hahaha that would be a pain in the  with live bait.
Ya, all them squirming mice would make a heck of a tangled mess for sure.
Im going to try one next week when i am up north. Wish me luck!      Darren
It must be a pain in the unhooking a fish from that rig.Especially if it gets hooked by all 10 of the trebles from 5 lures.
Actually it is no problem at all. Pike love this thing, I used swimbaits (4 hooks), but I plan on trying some inline spinners on the rig this weekend.
Well...you dont know me First time i would use one, you would have to take me to the hospital emergency, where they would laff thier off at me.
lol . dude i got to give this a try LOL
Maybe GreenCoachDog will chime in on the finer qualities of this setup.
